name: B. Eight Point Sets
statement:
Gerald is very particular to eight point sets. He thinks that any decent
eight point set must consist of all pairwise intersections of three
distinct integer vertical straight lines and three distinct integer
horizontal straight lines, except for the average of these nine points.
In other words, there must be three integers and three more integers ,
such that , and the eight point set consists of all points (), except
for point .You have a set of eight points. Find out if Gerald can use
this set?
